results.title: Sex roles
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A program designed for teenagers which examines relevant issues facing adolescence. This episode looks at sex-role stereotyping and how conditioning and assumptions made about the differences between sexes, can affect teenagers in their choice of career and their social behaviours.

results.title: Dating
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
Examines dating and focuses on the “first date” for teenagers. Looks at dating from the point of view of girls and boys, and first date etiquette. Also examines how other cultures see their children in relation to dating.

results.title: Teenage blues
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
An episode on boredom, boredom and more boredom. Teenagers, in a set of comic sketches, explore the “nowhere to go, nothing to do syndrome”. Once they take up the challenge of organising the school social, they realise that a creative and positive approach to overcoming boredom can solve the problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It’s About Time

results.title: Love
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This episode focuses on teenage reactions to love and relationships. Through mini dramatisations, issues such as crushes on teachers, how to be attractive to the opposite sex, romantic fiction and sex-role stereotyping, are examined in a humorous manner. This program aims at validating the experiences of teenagers rather than offering any concrete solutions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It’s About Time

results.title: Peer group
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This series of comic sketches and songs attempts to show the positive and negative outcomes of peer pressure on teenagers. While friends are valued, the message is clear; individuality should never be threatened by group pressure. Although the program offers few solutions to the problem of peer pressure, it does present the issue from a teenager’s perspective.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It’s About Time

results.title: Food
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A light hearted look at food by a group of “hungry” teenagers. Diets, fads, junk food addiction are discussed in a series of comic sketches and original songs. Information about nutrition and healthy lifestyle eating in a palatable format for adolescents.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A series of comic skits and songs which give a teenager’s view of family life. Deals with parental discipline, or lack of it, sibling rivalry, freedom, broken homes and family disputes.

results.title: School
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This anarchic series of comic sketches and songs expresses teenage views on school and teachers. School is seen as a meaningless prison where the students are given no space or time to explore and create.

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time for SBS Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A lighthearted exploration of the confusion and uncertainties surrounding adolescence through the eyes of 16 year olds from diverse backgrounds. Introduces the characters Tube, Gull, Curtis, Joey, Rosetta, Angela, Pepper and Gloria. Vignettes address “finding yourself, liking yourself and being your own person”, independence vs. limitations, the “real me”, friendships, peer group pressure and the physical/emotional changes occuring during the early teenage years. Similarly, the pressure of uncertain job prospects, school stresses, youthful dreams and concern for the world’s future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It’s About Time for SBS Television

Vignettes address “finding yourself, liking yourself and being your own person”, independence vs. limitations, the “real me”, friendships, peer group pressure and the physical/emotional changes occuring during the early teenage years. Similarly, the pressure of uncertain job prospects, school stresses, youthful dreams and concern for the world’s future.

A lighthearted exploration of the confusion and uncertainties surrounding adolescence through the eyes of 16 year olds from diverse backgrounds. Introduces the characters Tube, Gull, Curtis, Joey, Rosetta, Angela, Pepper and Gloria. Vignettes address “finding yourself, liking yourself and being your own person”, independence vs. limitations, the “real me”, friendships, peer group pressure and the physical/emotional changes occuring during the early teenage years. Similarly, the pressure of uncertain job prospects, school stresses, youthful dreams and concern for the world’s future.
